fullText: The musical, based on a documentary about autistic teenagers preparing for a spring formal, is tender and authentic, even if it sometimes feels more like a very good afterschool special than a fully realized Broadway show.
dtliExcerpt: With all that groundbreaking, perhaps it is no surprise that the production is otherwise very conventional, sometimes dispiritingly so.
bwwExcerpt: Perhaps it’s enough that “How to Dance in Ohio” offers solace and encouragement in a mild, conventional package. (There are cool-down spaces for those who need them, as one of the actors explains in welcoming the audience.) Doing sweet, reparative work for any part of humanity means doing sweet, reparative work for it all.
showScoreExcerpt: The musical, based on a documentary about autistic teenagers preparing for a spring formal, is tender and authentic, even if it sometimes feels more like a very good afterschool special than a fully realized Broadway show.
